8/10

This game scratched that Myst itch. Delivering an interesting setting, difficult but not impossible puzzles, and a fantastic ambiance. This game is easily worth a purchase at a $14.99 price point. Not sure the playtime/$ proposition is worth it above $21.99 unless you absolutely love this genre.

185396042.review: Rich experience, but I won't play anything by this group again. A few puzzles are practically impossible. I want to be able to solve the game myself. The killer, though, was a horrible ending. Game developers assume you will think the way they do - critical clues can easily be interpreted differently. Why build a maze where the exit is a death trap?

184903542.review: Целостный механизм, где почти каждый винтик переплетен с сюжетом и атмосферой, где все нужно соединить, чтобы он заработал в конце и сложилась история. Жду каждую игру этой студии больше, чем любые другие

184805228.review: An amazing story, very well told and incredibly fun to play. Some difficult puzzles (the Gauntlet Maze took me absolutely ages to work out) and some fantastic graphics. An exceptional game that I would definitely recommend.

184747557.review: A true follow-up to Cyan's greatest and a wholehearted recommend! Filled to the brim with mind-bending puzzles and secrets that I didn't even discover until the second playthrough. The music slaps! What more could you wish for!

184618267.review:
jeux pure Cyan, un bon classique pour les nostalgiques ou ceux qui veulent découvrir les "myst-likes". 
bref, j'ai adoré. mais bon, je suis fan de cyan (sauf Uru.. 😅 )

184590759.review: An amazing game!   Definitely lives up to all my expectations of Cyan.  The worlds is gorgeous and immersive as any from the Myst games.  For me it was the puzzles that made this game stand out.  They were significantly more challenging than those I remember in other Cyan games, but challenging in a good way.  You really have to think outside the box and figure out how to use the world itself to help you.  Even at 80% complete, after I had explored all the realms available, there were still new secrets about how the world of Obduction worked that I had to figure out.  Unfortunately the ending of the story line left me feeling a little disappointed, but that is my only complaint.  Overall this was an incredibly satisfying adventure puzzle game that I would recommend to anyone who enjoyed the Myst series!

184582691.review:
Obduction isn't a *bad* game, especially if you enjoy challenging puzzles. I found figuring out the [spoiler]base 4 number system[/spoiler] kind of fun, and something a bit more unique than the typical puzzle adventure game fare. But it really expects you to devour every detail and make some logical leaps at times that are just a bridge too far... and the cardinal sin that moves this to a "No" to me is this: Late in one biome, you are gated until you [spoiler]input a certain number to simply see a certain pod[/spoiler]... apparently originally you were supposed to see the number presented so going and inputting it nearby makes sense. But it seems due to some players not being able to see it... they simply made it so the number is not displayed anymore and instead you have to make quite a logical leap, brute force it, or look up a hint/guide.

If I could give this a "so-so" I would, as there's quite a lot I still like about the game. If you do enjoy challenging Myst-likes, I'd still give it a try (pick it up on sale), but if you find yourself stuck for too long, don't be afraid to find one of the hint guides to give yourself a nudge. Unfortunately the game does not have any such system built in... and depending what stage you're at, there could be a LOT of running back and forth (until you get enough shortcuts unlocked) including some potential load times which also help push this down a bit.

184483856.review: Great game! I found the game very challenging and it took me more than one attempt to solve it, which made it even more rewarding when I was able to move forward. Overall the game with its lore and graphics really grabbed me. Fair warning: There are a couple of red herrings and overall things can be frustrating because there are almost no hints most of the time for what you have to do next. I want to play more games like this.

184203072.review: Intriguing story line that has many different dimensions and many, many challenges along the way. Totally absorbing and universally perplexing.

183958399.review:
Obduction is an amazing game that is designed like a modern 'Myst'. It feels familiar yet completely alien.

The only thing that got annoying after a while are all the loading screens, but it's nothing game-breaking.

183829180.review: If you love puzzle games and you loved Myst, this game holds up 8 years on! It is meandering but if you stick with it it has an intriguing story. My recommendation is to play it through in a shorter time frame because it is easy to forget what you were going to do next if you leave it for a month or more.

183639099.review:
After having played several tens of games, this is the first time I have found a game to be uninteresting and poorly designed.
1 - The game mechanics are horrible. Loading times are very long (especially given that the maps are very small, with very few mobile elements) and swapping devices are very unpractical to use. Accessing photos is so inefficient that I ended up using my phone to take pictures.
2 - The game is way too hard, with difficulty not coming from interesting, mind-challenging riddles, but rather from the lack of explanations or guidelines that would teach you which lever you can pull or give you a goal. Figuring out these things for yourself is very unpleasant and makes the game feel like empty content with artifically increased duration.
3 - That being said, I managed to go through the whole game without a guide, except for one of the very last riddles of the game for which A SINGLE BUG CAUSED A CODE NOT TO BE SHOWN WHERE IT WAS SUPPOSED TO, thus rendering the game impossible to finish without help. What a nice gaming experience !
4 - The progression throughout the game is 95% linear, meaning if you get stuck on something, you can not simply try to go further on another riddle.
5 - Music gets a splendid 1/10

For reference, riddle games I have played and loved: Outer Wilds (+ DLC), Tunic, The Talos Principle, Fez, Return of The Obra Dinn, Chants of Sennaar

183527565.review: Captures the Myst/Riven feel, VR made it a lot of fun
